skillTree.localised_description: Revered as the noblest amongst the Great Stags, these exemplars see Marrisith as their friend and companion, and will ride with her to battle whenever she calls.

effects.description:
Charge bonus: +12% for Cavalry units

attributes.bullet_text: This unit can hide in forests until enemy units get too close.
This unit can fire while on the move.
This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
This unit can pass through trees.

skillTree.localised_description: A member of the Spirit Council of Laurelorn, this ancient treeman has sworn to aid the Queens of the Laurelorn since their first inception, for as long as they keep their oath to protect the forest.

attributes.bullet_text: This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
This unit frightens all enemy units, reducing their leadership when nearby. It is also immune to fear. Fear penalties do not stack.
This unit can cause terror, making its melee target rout for a short time. Units that cause terror are immune to terror and fear themselves.
When bracing, this unit negates the charge bonus of any attacker.
This unit can deploy outside the deployment zone.
This unit can hide in forests until enemy units get too close.
This unit can pass through trees.
This unit can fire while on the move.

skillTree.localised_description: Elven hunters emulate Kurnous, the God of the Hunt. Their speed and swiftness is therefore without peer.
A ranger should give no reprieve to the foe. Arrows must fall like a deluge, as deadly as lightning.
Having learned much in their long years of service, this character now turns their attention to training others.

effects.description: Character will share +15% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +20%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)
Character will share +30% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +35%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)
Character will share +50% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +50%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: When the arrow flies farther, it may kill sooner, which is vital in the Hunt.
Nook and fire. Nook again, and fire. Nook a third time, and fire. All in a heartbeat.
The forest teaches a warrior not only when to fire but where, which makes a bigger difference.
Always willing to fight on, a widened quiver allows arrows to rain, almost without end.
What the enemy cannot see, it cannot hit. What the enemy cannot see, it cannot survive.
By all means summon the bloodthirsty Goddess of the Hunt to assist you, but always make sure you thank her afterwardsâ€¦
From one bloodied, lifeless corpse to the next, this one is always looking for the next adversary to best.
Taking their cue from the forest itself, the Lord endures and overcomes all.
Using the forest itself as a shield, this Lord is protected by their devotion to Athel Loren.
When to strike, when to block, when to dodge. These are all skills the warriors of Athel Loren must perfect.
There is no greater thrill than to be in the midst of battle, slaughtering in the forest's name.
The war is endless. The cycle of charging, clashing, and bloody hand-to-hand fighting is without end. It will never stop.
The Lord embodies the forest; as a result of this, their warriors feel a greater call to defend it.
The Lord charges their troops to fight for Athel Loren, for their very souls are tethered to its fate.
Though she is aware of the grim curse bestowed upon the First Phoenix King and his bloodline, Marrisith carries this mantle with pride, honouring Aenarion's legacy in her reign.

attributes.bullet_text: The unit is immune to psychological attacks (Fear & Terror).

skillTree.localised_description: The forest spirits embrace the Eonir, living in harmony amongst them thanks to the legacy of harmony established by the Queens of the Laurelorn.
Even though she is young by elven standards, Marrisith has a natural affinity for politics and court affair, always, looking out for her kingdom's interests in the Old World.

effects.description: Diplomatic relations: +25 with Humans and High Elves

skillTree.localised_description: The Eonir have battled the other races countless times since their first arrival as colonists, defending their home from all manner of invaders and mastering new tactics through the centuries.
Since the coronation of Maruviel as the first Queen of the Laurelorn, all queens since have sworn to protect the forest and the spirits which reside within. Marrisith is no exception.

skillTree.localised_description: Both elves and spirits alike rejoice when they see their queen upon the battlefield, fighting with renewed strength and protecting her with their lives.

skillTree.localised_description: The denizens of the forest will travel many miles to see those who would threaten Athel Loren put to rout.
Athel Loren provides for its deserving children, with wondrous boons gifted in recognition of their many endeavours.
The Worldroots provide succour for their children, purging the forests of any corrupting infestation.
The magics of the woods obscure and connive, able to turn enemy blades away from their targets.
The forest provides for its warriors, rehabilitating and regenerating wounds suffered in its defence.
From all corners of the forest, they come to defend their homes.
"The time to strike is now!"

effects.description: Reinforcements supporting this army can have their arrival point adjusted by +250 metres without incurring any time penalty
Reinforcements supporting this army can have their arrival point adjusted by +600 metres without incurring any time penalty

Reinforcements supporting this army can have their arrival point adjusted by +1000 metres without incurring any time penalty

skillTree.localised_description: The dead do not want for material possessions, yet the living may yet find value in themâ€¦

skillTree.localised_description: Like the forest itself, the warriors of Athel Loren ebb and flow and regenerate with the passing of time.
A good quartermaster can ration equipment and foodstuffs efficiently, making supplies last longer.
The forest-dwellers draw from the strength of Kurnous to fight ever harder, and be ever stronger.

factionEffects.localised_description: The Queen of the Laurelorn has long felt that something is coming; a great war, a calamity orchestrated by the Dark Powers. Ten years ago she predicted a conflict that would bring the Old World to its knees, and the time has now come. The Eonir prepare for war.

effects.description: Gain +5 additional Forest Health for winning battles in Magical Forests or their Heathlands
Gain +3 additional Forest Health for razing Heathlands

Melee attack: +8 during forest battles
	(all armies)

items.colour_text: Revered as the noblest amongst the Great Stags, these exemplars see Marrisith as their friend and companion, and will ride with her to battle whenever she calls.
Said to be the only one of its kind, the jewel set atop this ring emanates light and energy as if it had a life of its own.

items.colour_text: A member of the Spirit Council of Laurelorn, this ancient treeman has sworn to aid the Queens of the Laurelorn since their first inception, for as long as they keep their oath to protect the forest.

The keeper of the stables and driver of the royal chariot, this stag master has served Queen Marrisith and her mother for hundred of years. His prescence on the battlefield helps keep the mounts steady.

	(Lord's army)

items.colour_text: Sent by the Everqueen herself, this princess acts as a diplomat and advisor to the Court of Laurelorn - though she also keeps an watchful eye on the descendants of Aenarion.

backgroundSkills.localised_description: The fourth queen of the Eonir and regent of the Laurelorn Forest is young by elven standards, but has already surpassed her predecessors in both power and wisdom.

ui_effects.localised_text: Summons a pack of Laddrielle's Wolves(Wolves Pack)
